poem:
### Markets Tremble

The minister speaks of markets in distress,  
Echoes of budget echoes,  
A nation stitched with trembling threads.  
In care homes, whispers of a quiet fall,  
Numbers crunched against walls of emptiness,  
Futures abandoned in the ledger's cold embrace.  
Who will care when columns disappear,  
Leaving only the echo of cautious footsteps?
